LisaacTM Platform

SDL_CDROM

CD-ROM Global access. (In order to use these functions, SDL_INIT must have been called with the CD-ROM initialization. This causes SDL to scan the system for CD-ROM drives, and load appropriate drivers.)
Inherit/Insert Summary
parent_object No developed.
 
Constructor Summary
create
Create and Set the cdrom given a drive number
 
STATUS
cd_traempy
No CD-ROM
cd_stopped
Stopped status
cd_playing
Playing status
cd_paused
Paused status
cd_error
Error status
DEVICES
nb_drives
Returns the number of CD-ROM drives on the system, or -1 if SDL_INIT.set_cdrom or SDL_INIT.set_evrything has not be called before.
drive_name
Returns a human-readable, system-dependent identifier for a given CD-ROM drive number. Example: /dev/cdrom or E:
 
Internal CD-ROM
status
This function returns the current status of the CD-ROM drive.
cd_indrive
Given a status, returns TRUE if there's a disk in the drive
cd_play_tracks
Play the given CD starting at start_track and start_frame for ntracks tracks and nframes frames. If both ntrack and nframe are 0, play until the end of the CD. This function will skip data tracks. This slot should only be called after calling the slot status to get track information about the CD. This function returns 0, or -1 if there was an error.
cd_play length
Play the given CD starting at start frame for length frames. It returns TRUE, or FALSE if there was an error.
cd_pause
Set the CD-ROM to pause.
cd_resume
Resume CD-ROM.
cd_stop
Stop playing CD-ROM.
eject
Eject CD-ROM.
close
Close CD-ROM drive handling.
 
TRACKS:
cd_numtracks
Return the number of tracks of the CD-ROM else 0.
cd_cur_track
Current track position
cd_cur_track_length
Length, in frames, of the current track
cd_track_length
Length, in frames, of a given track.
cd_cur_frame
Current frame offset within current track

cd_play_tracks

.../sdl_cdrom.li line #104

Section:
Public

Profile:
- Self: SELF. cd_play_tracks  ( start_track : INTEGER, start_frame : INTEGER, ntracks : INTEGER, nframes : INTEGER) : INTEGER

Description:
Play the given CD starting at start_track and start_frame for ntracks tracks and nframes frames. If both ntrack and nframe are 0, play until the end of the CD. This function will skip data tracks. This slot should only be called after calling the slot status to get track information about the CD. This function returns 0, or -1 if there was an error.

Description:
Play the given CD starting at start frame for length frames. It returns TRUE, or FALSE if there was an error.
